summary: Autumn, or fall, is one of Earth's four seasons, occurring between summer and winter. In the Northern Hemisphere, it starts in September, while in the Southern Hemisphere, it begins in March. During autumn, days get shorter, and temperatures drop. This season is famous for the beautiful transformation of deciduous tree leaves before they fall. The days grow shorter, and nights longer, until the winter solstice in December (Northern Hemisphere) or June (Southern Hemisphere).
title: Autumn
